threads.title: 5) Handoffs back to n8n (only if needed later)
threads.excerpt:
# 5) Handoffs back to n8n (only if needed later)
When the Project moves beyond Notion-only work, n8n resumes. Create a **checkbox** property on **Projects** called **“External Orchestration Required”*

threads.title: 9) Metrics (what “good” looks like)
threads.excerpt:
- If anything looks off, set the Project back to `Status = Proposed` and move the Idea row to `Maturity = Seed`.  
- Because we never delete/rename properties automatically, rolling back is just chang

learnings.summary:
Correction: ### DB Template: “Seed → Project”
- Creates a linked **Project Seed** in Projects with:
  - `Project
learnings.details:
### DB Template: “Seed → Project”
- Creates a linked **Project Seed** in Projects with:
  - `Project` = auto-title from Idea
  - `Area` = inferred from Audience/Tags
  - `Status` = “Proposed”
  - Starter subpages:
    - “Problem & Outcome”
    - “Users & Jobs-to-be-done”
    - “Scope v1 (MVP)”
    - “Risks & Assumptions”
    - “Metrics & Definition of Done”

## B. 5) Generate starter pages
   - Under the Project, create subpages:
     • Problem & Outcome
     • Users & Jobs-to-be-done
     • Scope v1 (MVP)
     • Risks & Assumptions
     • Metrics & Definition of Done
   - Populate each with concise scaffolding paragraphs and bullet checklists
learnings.evidence:
### DB Template: “Seed → Project”
- Creates a linked **Project Seed** in Projects with:
  - `Project` = auto-title from Idea
  - `Area` = inferred from Audience/Tags
  - `Status` = “Proposed”
  - Starter subpages:
    - “Problem & Outcome”
    - “Users & Jobs-to-be-done”
    - “Scope v1 (MVP)”
    - “Risks & Assumptions”
    - “Metrics & Definition of Done”

## B
